data.question: What materials were used in the synthesis of CAM-Ag nanofibers and membranes?
data.answer: Melamine, cyanuric acid, silver nitrate, and ammonia solution were used.

data.question: How was the concentration of Ag+ determined in the synthesis process?
data.answer: The concentration of Ag+ was determined by inductively coupled plasma optical emission spectrometry (ICP-OES).

data.question: What technique was used to observe the morphology of the samples?
data.answer: Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) and cryogenic transmission electron microscopy (cryo-TEM) were used.

data.question: Is the CAM-Ag membrane capable of being bent over 90 degrees?
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the purpose of adding ammonia solution in the synthesis of CAM-Ag nanofibers?
data.answer: Ammonia solution was added to neutralize the excess protons and facilitate the complete transformation of CAM nanorods to CAM-Ag nanofibers.

data.question: Did the CAM-Ag membrane demonstrate selective light transmission?
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the Young's Modulus of the CAM-Ag membrane according to the tensile tests?
data.answer: The average Young's Modulus was 77 ± 10 MPa.

data.question: What method was used for single crystal X-ray structure determination of CAM-Ag?
data.answer: Single crystal X-ray diffraction (SCXRD) data was collected on the MX2 beamline at the Australian Synchrotron.

data.question: Can the CAM-Ag membrane retain its crystal structures up to 150 °C?
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the main driving force for the conversion in the synthesis of CAM-Ag nanofibers?
data.answer: The reaction with Ag(I) was the driving force for the conversion, rather than the basic environment.

data.question: Was PLATON SQUEEZE used in the refinement of the CAM-Ag crystal structure?
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the role of the nanoindentation technique in the study?
data.answer: Nanoindentation was used for mechanical tests of the integral membranes and the single fibers.

data.question: What was the bending stiffness of CAM-Ag fibers according to the three-point bending test?
data.answer: The bending stiffness was determined to be 12.1 N/m for CAM-Ag.

data.question: Did the CAM-Ag membrane show almost no transmission in the range of UV, visible, and near-IR light?
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the main challenge in solving the crystal structure of CAM-Ag?
data.answer: The crystal displayed pronounced twinning due to the lamellar nature of the fibers, which was a challenge in solving the structure.

data.question: Was the crystal structure of CAM-Ag solved in the space group P1?
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the empirical formula of the CAM-Ag compound according to the crystal data?
data.answer: The empirical formula was C6H7Ag2N9O3.

data.question: What was the role of silver nitrate in the synthesis of CAM-Ag nanofibers?
data.answer: Silver nitrate provided Ag(I) ions that incorporated into the framework forming coordinate bonds with nitrogen atoms from melamine and cyanuric acid.

data.question: Did the synthesis process involve the use of ultrapure water?
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the main goal of the study?
data.answer: The main goal was to synthesize a robust, free-standing, centimeter-sized supramolecular membrane through competitive incorporation of Ag(I) into the hydrogen-bonded CAM network.
